attributes.action: Lower Degree Classification Boundaries and Alternative Assessments for Students
attributes.additional_details:
We need to look after our students. they are our future doctors. nurses. teachers. Engineers. Scientists

UK Students have not been given a fair chance. They have not been given adequate support off the government compared to GCSE/A-Level and BTEC Students.

Some Universities have had lecturers leave or be fired due to lack of funding and students - Leaving the students to fend for themselves and leaving them in the dark about their Exams/assessments
attributes.background: Consider Lowering the degree class Boundaries and consider setting alternative assessments or predicted grades for students as sitting exams and final exams during a pandemic is a very unfair representation of a students true work

rejection.details:
Decisions about university courses are a matter for individual universities, not the UK Government or Parliament. The Office for Students has published guidance for providers about quality and standards during the coronavirus (COVID-19) pandemic, which sets out its expectations regarding teaching and assessments: https://www.officeforstudents.org.uk/publications/guidance-for-providers-about-quality-and-standards-during-coronavirus-pandemic/ 

If you have concerns about your university's arrangements for teaching and assessment you should raise these with your university or the Office for Students, which regulates the higher education sector.
